"Big Stone Gap" is a novel written by Adriana Trigiani.
Adriana Trigiani has written other novels such as "Very Valentine" and "The Shoemaker's Wife."

The movie Big Stone Gap is based on the novel of the same name by Adriana Trigiani. It is a romantic comedy set in a small town in Virginia. The protagonist of the story is a self-sufficient, independent woman named Ave Maria Mulligan who finds herself at a crossroads in her life. The movie adaptation was directed by Adriana Trigiani herself, and it stars Ashley Judd, Patrick Wilson, Whoopi Goldberg, and Jane Krakowski.; [0]
The movie is set in the town of Big Stone Gap, Virginia.; [0]
The themes explored in the movie Big Stone Gap include love, friendship, and small-town life.; [1]
